SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler

Interface HelloHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
LocalDeliveryHandler, SimpleRelayHandler
public interface HelloHandler
Handler for client greeting commands (HELO/EHLO) and pre-mail commands.

This handler is active after the connection is accepted and waiting for the client to identify itself. It receives HELO/EHLO commands and authentication notifications.

After accepting a greeting with HelloState.acceptHello(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.MailFromHandler), the handler transitions to MailFromHandler where MAIL FROM commands can be received.

STARTTLS

STARTTLS is handled automatically by the connection when available. If the client requests STARTTLS and TLS is configured, the connection performs the TLS handshake and then:

  1. Calls tlsEstablished(TLSInfo) with session details
  2. Awaits the required post-TLS EHLO (RFC 3207)
  3. Calls hello(boolean, java.lang.String, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.HelloState) with the new EHLO

Authentication

SASL authentication mechanics are handled by the connection. After successful authentication, authenticated(java.security.Principal, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.AuthenticateState) is called with the authenticated Principal for policy decision.

Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Method Details

    • hello

      void hello(boolean extended, String hostname, HelloState state)
      Called when the client sends HELO or EHLO.

      The handler should evaluate the client's hostname and decide whether to accept or reject the greeting. Accepting transitions to the mail-from ready state.

      Parameters:
      extended - true for EHLO (Extended SMTP), false for HELO
      hostname - the client's announced hostname
      state - operations for responding to the greeting

    • tlsEstablished

      void tlsEstablished(TLSInfo tlsInfo)
      Called when TLS is established after STARTTLS.

      STARTTLS is handled automatically by the connection. This notification allows the handler to log the TLS upgrade or adjust policy based on TLS parameters.

      After this call, the client must re-issue EHLO per RFC 3207, which will arrive via hello(boolean, java.lang.String, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.HelloState).

      Parameters:
      tlsInfo - information about the TLS session

    • authenticated

      void authenticated(Principal principal, AuthenticateState state)
      Called after successful SASL authentication.

      The connection handles the SASL exchange (challenges, responses). This method is called after successful authentication with the authenticated identity.

      The handler should decide whether to accept this principal for sending mail.

      Parameters:
      principal - the authenticated identity
      state - operations for accepting or rejecting

    • quit

      void quit()
      Called when the client sends QUIT.

      The connection will send a 221 response and close. ClientConnected.disconnected() will be called.
